intro: Parathesis tenorioi, commonly known as the Tenorio's parathesis, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like calla lilies and peace lilies. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescence that resembles a spadix, typical of the genus Parathesis. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Parathesis tenorioi is considered a conservation concern.
